channel.title: Education News
channel.description: A RSS feed containing the latest education related news from NASA.

item.title: Maryland Students, Navy Pilots to Hear from NASA Astronauts in Space
item.description: Pilots from the U.S. Naval Test Pilot School in Patuxent River, Maryland, and students across southern Maryland will have an opportunity this week to hear from NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Langley STEM Outreach Pays Dividends with Virginia Beach Schools
item.description: Students took part in a variety of activities with Langley subject matter experts related to landing humans on the Moon via the Artemis mission and modeling a spacecraft docking station.

item.title: SOAR High School Student Wins NASA Armstrong Scholarship
item.description: The NASA Armstrong Employee Exchange Council presented the 2022 John W. Russell Memorial Scholarship Award to Katelyn Perez.

item.title: NASA Langley Welcomes Virginia Teachers as Part of 2022 MODSIM Program
item.description: Nearly a dozen middle- and high-school math educators from across Virginia spent June 23 at Langley - a culminating experience after a year of virtual online work in these areas using online sessions in Microsoft TEAMS, digital badges and other webinars.

item.title: NASA Interns’ First Day at Goddard
item.description: From working at home to a hybrid internship, Goddard welcomes the triumphant return of some students.

item.title: NASA Administrator, STEM Partner Connect Orlando Children with Artemis
item.description: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson helped hand out food with an extra serving of STEM activities to children and families at New Beginnings Church – The Gathering Place in Orlando, Florida, on Friday, June 3.

item.title: NASA Selects Minority-Serving Institution Proposals to Receive Support
item.description: The awardees in the first MSI Space Accelerator have been announced after a competitive application process in which they were encouraged to think like startup businesses.

item.title: NASA Administrator to Launch Artemis Learning Lunchbox Initiative
item.description: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson is helping kick off a new initiative to deliver food and hands-on science, technology, engineering, and math kits, called Learning Lunchboxes, in Orlando at 10:30 a.m. EDT on Friday, June 3.

item.title: NASA Administrator, Arizona Students to Hear from Station Astronauts
item.description: Students from Arizona will have an opportunity this week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

item.title: NASA Administrator to Visit Florida Students, Industry
item.description: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson will speak to elementary school students about the future of space exploration Monday, May 9, and tour a lab working on robotic construction technologies Tuesday, May 10, during a trip to Florida.
